context.item: MADS 2.1 is an XML schema developed by the Library of Congress for authority metadata description.
It's used to describe entities such as people, organizations, events, terms, and geographic locations that can be involved in creating or publishing creative works.
MADS 2.1 is designed to complement the Metadata Object Description Schema (MODS) and can carry data from MARC 21 authority records.
Version 2.1 (released in 2016) added elements to align with MADS RDF, including personInfo, organizationInfo, familyInfo, fieldOfEndeavor, locale, and workInfo.
Authority data is crucial for maintaining consistent references to entities across collections and enabling precise identification and retrieval.
Your task is to analyze the provided content and create a valid MADS 2.1 representation for any authority entities identified.
Focus on extracting the core required elements while including additional metadata when available.
The resulting MADS 2.1 XML should be well-formed and adhere to the MADS schema specifications.
When identifying authority entities, consider their roles, relationships, and any variant forms of their names or terms.
Pay attention to hierarchical relationships and appropriate classification of authority types.
